children.subject: There's no final for this class during finals week. If we decide to have a final it will be in class!

Good to know!

One last thing: Is the enrollment process on a first-come basis? Since if I remember correctly, that was the case for the F18 semester.

No, there's an application (http://apply.imt-decal.org). All applicants who submit by the deadline are equally considered (and that was the case in F18 as well). Let me know if you have any other questions!
If we decide to take this class during the timing for another class (that is being web-casted) do we need to worry about a clash in the final's timing? Or will the exam be held during class timing?

history.content:
The application to Introduction to Mathematical Thinking, a 2-unit DeCal that aims to develop mathematical maturity and prepare students for courses like CS 70, is now live! http://apply.imt-decal.org

Many courses at Berkeley require a certain type of mathematical thinking that isn't taught in high school math courses, and as a result many students struggle. The students who have seen this content and type of thinking before tend to find such courses much more manageable. 

Introduction to Mathematical Thinking is a 2-unit DeCal meant to expose students to some ideas and concepts in discrete mathematics before they're tested on them in future courses. The course will cover topics such as proof techniques, set theory, number theory and combinatorics. 

The course will be scheduled on T/Th from 3:30-5:00PM, in LeConte 2.

Check out the full list of topics, along with the FAQs, at the course website: http://imt-decal.org.  Materials from the Fall 2018 iteration of the course can be found at http://imt-decal.org/fa18.html. The application deadline is January 23rd, at 11:59PM. Apply at http://apply.imt-decal.org.

Feel free to email us at imt-decal@berkeley.edu if you have any questions!
history.subject: Intro to Mathematical Thinking DeCal Application
